thread.title: Thief Messes With the Wrong Texan, Winds Up Paying the Ultimate Price
thread.title_full: Thief Messes With the Wrong Texan, Winds Up Paying the Ultimate Price

author: Kim Smith
title: Thief Messes With the Wrong Texan, Winds Up Paying the Ultimate Price
text:
Wall Will Be Well Underway Within The Next 2 Years 
WFAA reported that the Arlington Police Department responded to a shooting in the 3700 block of French Wood Drive about 3 a.m. 
When law enforcement arrived at the scene, officers found the 17-year-old man in the street with a gunshot wound near the residence. According to the Star-Telegram, a neighbor across the street said when she heard the commotion, she went outside and saw the teenager on the ground about 20 feet from the car. She added that the car was damaged in two places by at least one bullet. 
The teenager was transported to a hospital where authorities pronounced him dead.   
Police are investigating the incident as a vehicle burglary that was interrupted by the homeowner. 
The Associated Press reported that a second suspect fled the scene before police arrived. 
According to WFAA, no arrests had been made as of Monday morning. 
The Tarrant County Medical Examiner’s Office was expected to release the teenager’s identity after his family had been notified.
